input.description: In the model, only the surface CH4 concentration were forced to follow the prescribed trajectory, but CH4 concentrations above the surface were calculated interactively, and the full 3D field was then passed to the model's radiation scheme. As CH4 concentrations were only prescribed at the surface, CH4 in HadGEM2-ES above the surface is free to evolve a non-uniform structure and may differ from the prescribed, well-mixed historical concentrations. The impact of passing a full 3D CH4 field from UKCA to the radiation scheme rather than passing a uniform concentration everywhere was evaluated in a present-day atmosphere-only configuration of the HadGEM1 model (Johns et al., 2006; Martin et al., 2006). It was found to cool the extra-tropical stratosphere by 0.5-1.0 K, thereby reducing the warm temperature biases in the model (O'Connor et al., 2009).

input.description: The historical land use data is based on the HYDE database v3.1 (Klein Goldewijk et al., 2010a; Klein Goldewijk et al., 2010b) as processed for CMIP5 by Hurtt et al (2010), and made available at 0.5 x 0.5 degree resolution. These fractions are mapped on to the N96 grid using area average re-gridding.

conformance.description: Includes methane (surface), nitrous oxide, halocarbons and ozone (stratospheric) for preindustrial conditions

reference.description: Reference to a NumericalRequirement called bc.001 in a experiment called 3.1 piControl

reference.name: bc.002
reference.description: Reference to a NumericalRequirement called bc.002 in a experiment called 3.1 piControl

conformance.description: Includes ethane, propane, carbon monoxide, formaldehyde, acetaldehyde, acetone, nitrous oxides (surface), and nitrous oxides (aircraft) for preindustrial conditions.

reference.name: bc.003
reference.description: Reference to a NumericalRequirement called bc.003 in a experiment called 3.1 piControl

conformance.description: Includes secondary organic aerosols from biogenic emissions for preindustrial conditions. All other natural aerosols are simulated interactively (ammonium sulphate, fossil-fuel black carbon, fossil-fuel organic carbon, biomass burning, sea-salt and mineral dust)

reference.name: bc.007
reference.description: Reference to a NumericalRequirement called bc.007 in a experiment called 3.1 piControl

conformance.description: Preindustrial values for the prescribed fractions of urban areas, lakes, ice, broadleaf tree, needleleaf tree, C3 grass, C4 grass, shrub and bare soil are provided.

reference.name: IBM Power 6

reference.name: HadGEM2-ES
reference.description: Reference to a modelComponent called HadGEM2-ES

standard.name: QN_DRS
standard.description: The QN_DRS value allows mapping from data files to metadata being exported from the metadata questionnaire, and contains the insitution name, the model name on which the simulation was run, and the experiment name to which the simulation conforms. Additionally, for a non-ensemble run, a rip value will be included. The format of the string will thus be: institute_model_experiment.
